Message: Hi, Iâ€™m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
hi, how does the billing work. can i be billed monthly?

Hey there! Yes, you can be billed monthly. NewsBreak offers two main billing options: Autopay and Prepay. With Autopay, you store a credit card on file and are charged when the billing threshold is met or at the end of the month. Prepay allows you to add credits to your account before running ads. For more details, check out our Billing Guide here: [Billing Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17821681919757-Billing-Guide). Let me know if you have any other questions!
looking at my account now, am i on autopay or prepay?

I can't access your account details directly, but you can check your billing settings by logging into your NewsBreak account and navigating to the Billing Section. There, you'll see whether you're set up for Autopay or Prepay. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com.
where exactly do i click to check if i am on autopay or prepay?

To check if you're on Autopay or Prepay, log into your NewsBreak account and head to the 'Billing' section. Once there, look for options related to payment methods. If you see a credit card stored for automatic payments, you're likely on Autopay. If you see ad credits being added manually, then you're on Prepay. Let me know if you need more help!
Thank you for your feedback. You can click the close icon below to close this widget.
Thanks for contacting us and we want to hear from you!
how do i know the next time i will get billed

If you're on Autopay, you'll be billed when you reach your billing threshold or at the end of the month. For Prepay, you won't receive a bill; instead, you'll need to add credits to your account before running ads. You can check your billing cycle and next billing date in the 'Billing' section of your NewsBreak account. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out!
i am on autopay, how do i know my billing end of the month and also how do i know what my billing threshold is

If you're on Autopay, you'll be billed for any outstanding balance at the end of the month, regardless of your billing threshold. To find out your specific billing threshold, log into your NewsBreak account and check the 'Billing' section. Your threshold should be listed there along with other payment details. If you need further assistance, feel free to contact adsupport@newsbreak.com.
so say my billing threshold is $50 and my next billing is august 31st, 2025, and i a run an ad today that spends $100, when will get billed. will i get billed today or on August 31st.

If your billing threshold is $50 and you run an ad that spends $100, you'll be billed as soon as you hit the $50 threshold. So, in this case, you'd be billed today for the amount that exceeds your threshold. Any remaining balance will be billed on August 31st, 2025. Let me know if you have more questions!
is your team available on the weekends to approve ads ?
Yes, our team is available on weekends to review ads. On average, ads are reviewed within 4 hours on weekdays and up to 8 hours on weekends. If you have any urgent requests, feel free to reach out!
what type of ad is reporting the highest CTR based on your knowledge

I don't have real-time data on which ad type is currently reporting the highest CTR. However, you can evaluate the effectiveness of your ads by checking the CTR in your account's reporting section. This will give you insights into which ad formats are performing best for your campaigns. If you need help with accessing reports, feel free to ask!
hi
Hello! How can I assist you today?
i am trying to upload a video, i keep getting an error message saying my video must be less than 20M, my video is only 31 seconds long

It sounds like the file size of your video might be exceeding the limit, even if it's only 31 seconds long. Make sure your video file is less than 20MB in size. You can try compressing the video or reducing its resolution to meet the size requirement. If you continue to have issues, feel free to reach out for more help!
how do i compress its size

You can compress your video using online tools like HandBrake or Clipchamp. These tools allow you to adjust the resolution and bitrate, which can help reduce the file size. Simply upload your video to one of these platforms, select the desired settings, and download the compressed version. Let me know if you need more guidance!
what is the url for HandBrake

You can visit HandBrake's official website at [https://handbrake.fr](https://handbrake.fr) to download the software and start compressing your video. If you have any questions about using it, feel free to ask!
handbrake is so confusing

I understand it can be a bit tricky at first! Here's a quick guide: 
1. Open HandBrake and select your video file. 
2. Choose a preset from the right panel, like 'Fast 1080p30' for a good balance of quality and size. 
3. Adjust the 'Video' settings to lower the bitrate if needed.
4. Click 'Start Encode' to compress your video.
If you need more help, feel free to ask!
